p: Fern et al. [ 127] also reported that P. ribesioides is antiseptic and stimulant with both the fruits and EO having diuretic and expectorant effects whilst also improving digestion. The EO of P. ribesioides is also reported to be carminative, diuretic and a stimulating expectorant. The immature, dried fruits are applied in the treatment of coughs, bronchitis, sinusitis, throat and genito-urinary infections, poor digestion and amoebic dysentery.
